User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110121 Firefox/4.0b10pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110121 Firefox/4.0b10pre

Symptoms:
1. The live RSS menu appears slightly too high, happens about 10% of the time, see http://nas.dyndns.org/temp/Screenshot1.png
2. On dual-head, the menu appears again about 10% of the time on the wrong screen, see http://nas.dyndns.org/temp/Screenshot2.png - this though happens only if the browser is on the laptop display, the menus then occasionally appearing on the external display.
3. Somewhat different issue, if you left click a live rss button an immediately afterwards rightclick it, both the rss menu and the context menu appear, see http://nas.dyndns.org/temp/Screenshot3.png (reproducible 100% of the time).

This is a regression, used to work reliably up to at least ff4.0b9pre.

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the live rss menus a lot of times.
2.
3.
Actual Results:  
Occasionally out-of-place menu

Expected Results:  
Menus should be attached below or above the button and on the correct screen.

Using official FF4 nightly builds on F14 (xorg-x11-server-Xorg-1.9.3-4.fc14.x86_64).
